Author: DavoColo
Subject: Still wishing for a few features
Body:
I’m enjoying the wonderfulness of Firefox Photon, especially on the desktop. I’ve never seen the crashes, freezes, sync issues, or partial page loads that others mention. FF always works perfectly for me on iOS (and macOS and Linux for that matter). 

And, to be fair, many of the one-star reviews are from people who don’t know they can configure privacy controls, the homepage contents, Pocket and more — just like they want. That’s user error, not FF guys. 

My issues with FF involve missing features and interface oddities primarily. 

Here’s the main thing: The ability — finally — to edit bookmarks on the mobile device and sync to desktop is still not there. 

Sure, you can save a bookmark in a special “Mobile” folder and sync it back to the desktop version where you can then process it properly, move and rename it, and sync it back to iOS. (Whew!)

That’s a non-starter for me. 

You still can’t edit the bookmark name or URL, or save it into the main bookmark tree via iOS. Safari on desktop and iOS has been capable of this for how many years?

It’s the dealbreaker keeping me from moving to FF full time on iOS. 

My other gripe is the inability to set the app in permanent private mode, or set it to clear history and cookies on close, as you can in the desktop version. These are crucial to those of us who use FF primarily for its finely grained privacy settings. I’m surprised Mozilla has fallen down on this. 

Come on Mozilla, put some of that half-billion in search income into the mobile space! This is crucial for maintaining some kind of viability in the desktop space as well.

Author: DeeM838
Subject: Battery usage gone up?
Body:
I can’t be sure, but it feels like the battery usage has gone up in recent releases? Hard to tell, because I’m admittedly using the app more and more.

There’s a few bugs with a few features: night mode glitches out on lots of images (showing inverted photos), and sometimes persists image data from private sessions to ‘normal’ sessions. Occasionally after refreshing a page a few times, the app will not complete loading the body text, and you’ll need you to close a tab and re-open it in a fresh tab. All minor things that you can live with, they’re just enough to keep me from giving this a 5-Star.

Feature-wise, I often find the UX confusing between the two types of expand nav buttons (hamburger menu vs a ‘...’ menu), it’d be great to consolidate these.  I’d love having a chance to re-arrange the nav buttons; I can’t really reach the back button with my right thumb, and it’d be great to move that closer (as it’s my most commonly tapped object!). I’d also love a way to set Firefox as the default web browser, but that’s a Safari/iOS problem.

Subject: 1000 gånger bättre än safari
Body: Snabbare snyggare och fler inställningar än safari. Author: Pablo Gonzalez Mereides
Subject: Verbesserungswürdig
Body:
*iOS 11.2.2 - iPhone 7/ iPad Air 1*

Leider stürzt Firefox im privaten Modus immer ab, sobald man ein Tab schließt und einen neuen öffnet. 
Nervig

++ ab 5.0 ++

Wenn man sich auf einer Seite einloggt und oder in die Tab Übersicht geht, funktioniert die zurück Funktion nicht mehr. Als hätte man einen neuen Tab geöffnet. Furchtbar 
++

Leider ist der Browser ein bisschen langsam und Java Seiten wie Amazon oder eBay wollen die Bilder nicht richtig anzeigen bzw die Bilder lassen sich nicht weiterwischen. 

Außerdem sind die Tabs umständlich gelöst. Im Übersicht Modus ruckelt es ordentlich. 

Umständlich ist auch die Anordnung der Einstellungen. Etwas, das man öfters nutzt, wie das Löschen der History/Cookies, sinkt immer weiter nach unten. 
Sowas gehört höher!

Völlig daneben finde ich die Lösung der Favoriten, denn beim Start des Browsers ist man im History Modus, nicht wie beim Safari im Lesezeichen/ Favoriten Modus. Auch der Favoriten Stern in der unteren Leiste muss weg. Da gehört der Tab Switcher hin, denn immer dafür nach oben zu manövrieren ist umständlich, weil sich die anderen Aktionen unten sind ...

Toll fände ich auch den Browser im privaten Modus starten zu lassen, leider muss man den jedesmal neu aktivieren. 

Generell freue ich mich aber auf den Firefox, wurde er von Mozilla doch anfangs aufgegeben für iOS. Es gibt leider auch noch sehr viel Luft nach oben. 

Ob Apple es Drittanbieter Browser auch erlaubt AddOns wie AdBlocks zu nutzen?
Translated Body: * iOS 11.2.2 - iPhone 7 / iPad Air 1 * Unfortunately, Firefox always crashes in private mode as soon as you close a tab and open a new one. Annoying ++ from 5.0 ++ If you log in on a page and or go to the tab overview, the back function does not work anymore. Like having opened a new tab. Terrible ++ Unfortunately, the browser is a bit slow and Java sites like Amazon or eBay do not want to display the images properly or the images can not be wiped. In addition, the tabs are cumbersome. In the overview mode it jerky neat. The arrangement of the settings is also awkward. Something that is often used, such as clearing the history / cookies, continues to fall down. That's higher! Completely wrong, I find the solution of the favorites, because when you start the browser you are in the history mode, unlike the Safari in Bookmark / Favorites mode. Even the favorite star in the bottom bar has gone. There is the tab switcher, because always maneuvering upwards is cumbersome, because the other actions are below ... Great I would also like to start the browser in private mode, unfortunately, you have to re-activate each time. In general, I'm looking forward to the Firefox, he was initially abandoned by Mozilla for iOS. Unfortunately, there is still a lot of room for improvement. Whether Apple's third-party browser also allows to use AddOns like AdBlocks?

Author: fjpoblam
Subject: Bookmarks not editable AFAIK; can’t “view source”; no “Open in”
Body:
Advantage over Safari? Granular control over what parts of browser data may be purged: JUST history or JUST cookies or JUST cache… (Safari gives you all or nothing). And you can ship “mailto” links elsewhere instead of Mail.

Beyond that, nothing. Can’t edit bookmarks AFAIK. Can’t “view source” (easy with a tricky Safari bookmark).

The Mozilla folk didn’t see fit to register Firefox as an app available in the Share activities (“Open In”). Heck, I can open most stuff even in my Wikipedia reader app. It should be no big deal for Mozilla to get Firefox down in the list.

Bookmarks, view source, open-in: dealbreakers for me.

Author: iamhootis
Subject: Privacy, my rear
Body: Mozilla used to focus on user privacy and didn't just vacuum up user data and sell it to the highest bidder, but that seems to be constantly eroding. Every release appears to add more and more obfuscation to any control the user has (under the guise of more control, HA!) and allows companies like Google, who could care less about any human, to have access. I'm done, good luck Mozilla as you are no better than Chrome now, in my humble opinion.

Author: Hal3000x
Subject: 気に入ってます
Body:
iPadとiPhone、Macのすべてで愛用しています。
タブを大量に開いても遅くなりにくく、夜間モードなど意欲的な機能も多く気に入っています。

なお、夜間モード中にアドレスバーなどが白いままだと眩しいので、もう少しコントラストを落としてもらえるとより嬉しいです。

あと大量のタブを開いているとき、よりスムーズに左右のタブに行き来できるUIが追加されると嬉しいです。特にiPadで使用中に画面の上部まで手を伸ばすのが少し不便でして。色々なブラウザが色々なアプローチを試していますが、何か良い方法をよろしくお願いします！
Translated Body: I love it on all of the iPad, iPhone, Mac. Even if you open a large number of tabs, it will not be late, and I like a lot of ambitious features such as night mode. If the address bar etc is still white during night mode, it will be dazzling, so it will be more pleasing to have a bit more contrast. I'm also happy to have added a UI that allows you to go to the right and left tabs more smoothly when a lot of tabs are open. Especially it is a little inconvenient to reach out to the top of the screen while using on iPad. Various browsers are experimenting with various approaches, but thank you for something nice way!

Author: valoche_la_brioche
Subject: Presque parfait
Body: Sur le plan de la rapidité c’est parfait. Sur le choix du moteur de recherche également, on peut utiliser Qwant comme moteur de base tout en ajoutant Google ou Wikipedia aux moteurs annexes. Esthétiquement c’est tout aussi joli que la version desktop. La synchronisation fonctionne bien sauf pour l’envoi de liens d’un appareil à l’autre. La seule vraie amélioration à apporter serait de pouvoir personnaliser les barres d’outils (choix des boutons et du nombre de boutons, comme sur une version ordi).
Translated Body: In terms of speed it's perfect. On the choice of the search engine also, we can use Qwant as a basic engine while adding Google or Wikipedia to the additional engines. Aesthetically it's just as pretty as the desktop version. Synchronization works well except for sending links from one device to another. The only real improvement to be made is to be able to customize the toolbars (choice of buttons and number of buttons, as on a computer version).
